oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: On the Record with Ralph Emery: Tammy Wynette - 1994-08-24 Reel 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recordings are of the Ralph Emery Show. The show is hosted by Ralph Emery (entertainer), and features Emery in discussion with his guest: Tammy Wynette (musician). The show was recorded on August 24, 1994. The recordings are for parts four and five, of five parts, of Emery's interview of Wynette.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tammy Wynette; Ralph Emery
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Tammy Wynette reflects on how she was almost a hair-dresser, and Wynette and Ralph Emery reflect on what brought Wynette to Nashville, Tennessee -- (03:46) Emery reflects on the disc jockey convention that attacked Wynette to Nashville, Tennessee -- (05:24) Wynette reflects on when she met Porter Wagoner and his book -- (08:39) Emery invites Wynette to reflect on when she met Bill Sherrill and Calso Curston (unconfirmed) -- (13:39) Emery introduces Sherrill to recall how he met Wynette -- (15:54) Emery and Wynette discuss how "You Can Steal Me" was the first song Wynette sang Sherrill; additionally, Sherrill reflects on how he and Wynette came up with her name -- (18:12) Sherrill reflects on writing "Stand by Your Man" -- (18:55) Wynette reflects on never having material ahead of time -- (21:20) Sherrill reflects on how Wynette became the 'first lady' -- (22:07) Wynette reflects on a time where she almost gave up -- (23:07) Emery asks Wynette about when she met George Jones -- (26:42) Emery asks about who made a snide remark about female artists, and Wynette reflects on the controversy surrounding "Stand by Your Man" -- (30:01) Emery asks Wynette to summarize her relationship with Jones -- (34:28) Emery inquires about when Wynette met Burt Reynolds -- (36:26) Emery has Wynette reflect on how she would marry Reynolds -- (40:25) Emery asks about Wynette's image as a role-model -- (43:21) Emery inquires as to how Wynette believes she has bettered women -- (44:30) Emery asks Wynette to discuss her current husband: George Richey -- (48:00) Merle Haggard presents Wynette with the Lady of Country Music Award -- (48:47) Emery inquires about Wynette's upcoming schedule and the movie: Nashville -- (50:47) Your Good Girl's Gonna Go Bad [excerpt] (Tammy Wynette) -- (51:07) Loretta Lynn praises Wynette -- (51:37) Emery inquires about Lynn, Dolly Parton, and Wynette's collaboration -- (54:11) Emery says goodbye to Wynette
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Wynette, Tammy; Emery, Ralph;
